intro: Melicope tiarapuensis, commonly known as the Tiarapuensis mahogany, is a tropical tree native to the island of Moorea in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The tree is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and compound leaves with a glossy upper surface. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are followed by woody, spherical fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
